sub_title: Connecting students and institutions 🎓 Chair of ESN’s Committee for Education 🇪🇺 | International Education, Marketing and recruitment, Erasmus+ and Mobility, Youth, Employability
summary:
🌟 Seeking a new professional opportunity in Higher Education in The Netherlands! 🎓
____
Hi, I’m Gloria! Welcome to my world of empowering youth, connecting generations, and championing education for a brighter future! I'm a communication and marketing professional with 5 years of experience in international education, driven to make a difference in higher education. With a strong passion for global citizenship and cultural exchange, I strive to create impactful experiences for Gen Z and the next generation, bridging cultures and shaping a more interconnected world.

My journey began in a small Italian town, where I embarked on my first international adventure at the age of 11. This ignited a lifelong passion for cultural exchange and education. Since then, I've made a meaningful impact, reaching hundreds of thousands of students globally through social media and live events.

I pursued a Bachelor's degree in Corporate Communication and Public Relations at IULM University in Milan, where I immersed myself in the Erasmus+ program. As a proud member of the #ErasmusGeneration, I became deeply involved with the Erasmus Student Network (ESN), where I have served on different national and international boards. 

Continuously seeking new challenges, at 18 I started my career journey with YouAbroad as Communication and Social Media Coordinator, where I honed my expertise in marketing and communication strategy, working side by side with the CEO, Managing Director and Marketing Manager. 

I currently live in The Netherlands after an incredible gap year and I am a Marketing and Communication Strategy Consultant at YouAbroad. On the side, I am the Main Chair of the International Committee for Education of the Erasmus Student Network and a commissioner of the Italian Youth Council in the Education and Career Committee.

My personal purpose is to foster global citizenship and development through education. With my specialization in higher international education, marketing, and communication strategy, I strive to create meaningful connections and bridge cultures.

If you're passionate about making a difference and expanding your global network, let's connect over a (virtual) coffee! Send me a message on LinkedIn!

profile_positions.title: Main Chair - International Committee for Education @ ESN AISBL

profile_positions.description:
The International Committee for Education (ICE) has the goal to raise the status of ESN as an important organisation in the field of youth policies and higher education at the local, national and European level, to support the development of an advocacy strategy, and to obtain knowledge to implement the network's advocacy strategy.

Within the Team of Erasmus+ Implementation, promotion of Erasmus+ and editing of the Erasmus+ Documents Toolkit with explanations of the documents involved, from the participant perspective, aimed at the Network's +500 sections
profile_positions.title: International Committee for Education - Erasmus+ Implementation Team @ ESN AISBL

profile_positions.description:
The Erasmus Student Network (ESN) is the biggest European student organization, supported by the European Commission, acting in the field of student mobility and internalization of higher education. ESN’s main mission is the enrichment of society through international students and student mobility, thus providing opportunities for cultural understanding and self-development in over 500 universities across Europe.

ESN provides support services to its main target audience, 500 000 international students across Europe per year and works for their needs by facilitating their mobility period, ensuring social cohesion and integration of mobile students in local communities by enhancing intercultural awareness and active citizenship through intercultural dialogue and cultural activities and volunteering and outreach initiatives. 

As Network Manager in the national board of ESN The Netherlands, I’m in charge of social impact implementation through the ESN Causes of Education and Youth, Culture, Social Inclusion, Health and Well-Being, Environmental Sustainability and Skills and Employability, as well as the international relations of the organization towards external stakeholders and the other +40 ESN National Organizations for the country of the Netherlands. Some of my achievements include: a two-years National Strategy on Well-Being, Safety and Inclusion, the board and board support restructure, the #ESN4SocialImpact project, a year-round strategy for internationalization of the National Organization and the first KA2 Erasmus+ project with ESN Italy.
profile_positions.title: National Board Member - Network Manager @ ESN The Netherlands

profile_positions.description: As President and Board Member, I was the main contact for the University and institutional partners. I led a team in organizing activities and events for over 6000 international students from 10+ universities in Milan. I successfully worked on local and national grants to enhance our services. By collaborating with the universities, the municipality of Milan, local associations, and partners, we fostered cultural integration and created a platform for cross-cultural exchange, significantly improving the international student experience in Milan.
profile_positions.title: President and Board Member, volunteer @ ESN Milano IULM

profile_positions.description: In my role as National Sub-Coordinator for Skills & Employability development at ESN Italy, I played a pivotal role in empowering students with valuable skills for their future career, enhancing employability within mobility experiences and youth work.
profile_positions.title: National Sub-Coordinator Skills & Employability development @ ESN Italy

profile_positions.description:
I provide corporate communication and marketing consultancy services, reporting directly to the CEO, Managing Director, and Marketing Manager. Here are some key projects I undertook:

- Restructured alumni strategy in collaboration with higher education institutes and companies.
- Developed and implemented a brand reputation strategy to enhance brand image and perception.
- Designed and executed event strategy, including a pre-departure event for over 600 students and virtual events, ensuring a seamless and engaging experience.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager, Marketing and Organizational Strategy Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Within the Employee Experience and Employer Branding team, my objective was to lead and drive the implementation of EY’s Employee Value Proposition “The Exceptional EY Experience: it’s yours to build.”

Main tasks: 

- Creating, supporting and monitoring national and international employer branding campaigns, working with the Italian Talent Acquisition Team, EY Europe West and EY Global. eg. EY4NextGeneration, UniqueLikeYou, EY NextGen Women, Women in Tech, SheBelongs in Strategy and Transactions etc.
- Managing the development of impactful content designed around storytelling principles for a variety of audiences using multiple communication channels, including print, multi-media, social networks and web
- Social Media, content and ads strategy for multiple teams (ie. Diversity & Inclusion, Learning, Audit recruting team, Service Lines, Leadership team etc). Responsible for analysis and strategy to increase external reputation, positive sentiment and employer awards.
- Developing and executing the early talent strategy; advocating for campus recruiting strategies and providing  input on cross Talent Acquisition matters including people, process, and technology.
- Supporting employer branding and employee experience events. Eg. University careers fairs, corporate meetings, corporate events
profile_positions.title: Communication, Employer Branding and Employee Experience Associate
Communication Coordinator and Head of Social Media

profile_positions.description:
During my Erasmus experience in Belgium, I joined I LOVE Network:  the city platform to empower creative talents, local entrepreneurs and smart cities across Belgium. 

Main tasks:

- Meeting with local talents and entrepreneurs to narrate their story and drive jobs and consumers across Hasselt (Belgium)
- Creating empowering videos to promote the city opportunities 
- Leading the vision of bringing innovation to small cities through intercultural dialogue
